alert.note: Alert for Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 6:38PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lee and central Sumter Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 637 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elliott, or 9 miles south of Bishopville, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bishopville, Lee State Park, Elliott, Mulberry, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Manville, Spring Hill, St. Charles, Wisacky, Woodrow, Shiloh and East Sumter. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 114 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 138 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
